class WidgetPager
class PagerTabStrip

Detailed Description

Base class providing the provider to populate pages inside of a WidgetPager, the page content should be Widget.

For information about how to create and resolve IPagerProvider, reference to WidgetPager.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::destroyItem ( gaia::core::WidgetController *  container,
int32_t  position,
gaia::core::Widget *  object 
) [virtual]

Remove a page for the given position.

The provider is responsible for removing the widget from its container, although it only must ensure this is done by the time it returns from finishUpdate(WidgetController).

Parameters:
containerThe containing Widget from which the page will be removed.
positionThe page position to be removed.
objectThe same widget that was returned by instantiateItem(Widget, int).
virtual void gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::finishUpdate ( gaia::core::WidgetController *  container) [virtual]

Called when the a change in the shown pages has been completed.

At this point you must ensure that all of the pages have actually been added or removed from the container as appropriate.

Parameters:
containerThe containing Widget which is displaying this provider's page widgets.
virtual int32_t gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::getCount ( ) [pure virtual]

Return the number of widgets available.

virtual int32_t gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::getItemPosition ( gaia::core::Widget *  object) [virtual]

Called when the host widget is attempting to determine if an item's position has changed.

Returns POSITION_UNCHANGED if the position of the given item has not changed or POSITION_NONE if the item is no longer present in the provider.

The default implementation assumes that items will never change position and always returns POSITION_UNCHANGED.

Parameters:
objectWidget representing an item, previously returned by a call to instantiateItem(Widget, int).
Returns:
object's new position index from (0, {getCount()}), POSITION_UNCHANGED if the object's position has not changed, or POSITION_NONE if the item is no longer present.
virtual gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::getPageTitle ( int32_t  position) [virtual]

This method may be called by the WidgetPager to obtain a title string to describe the specified page.

This method may return null indicating no title for this page. The default implementation returns null.

Parameters:
positionThe position of the title requested
Returns:
A title for the requested page
virtual float gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::getPageWidth ( int32_t  position) [virtual]

Returns the proportional width of a given page as a percentage of the WidgetPager's measured width from (0.f-1.f].

Parameters:
positionThe position of the page requested
Returns:
Proportional width for the given page position
virtual gaia::core::Widget* gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::instantiateItem ( gaia::core::WidgetController *  container,
int32_t  position 
) [virtual]

Create the page for the given position.

The provider is responsible for adding the widget to the container given here, although it only must ensure this is done by the time it returns from finishUpdate(WidgetController).

Parameters:
containerThe containing widget in which the page will be shown.
positionThe page position to be instantiated.
Returns:
Returns an Widget representing the new page.
virtual bool gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::isWidgetFromObject ( gaia::core::Widget *  widget,
gaia::core::Widget *  object 
) [pure virtual]

Determines whether a page Widget is associated with a specific key object as returned by instantiateItem(WidgetController, int).

This method is required for a IPagerProvider to function properly.

Parameters:
widgetPage Widget to check for association with object
objectWidget to check for association with widget
Returns:
true if widget is associated with the key Widget widget
virtual void gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::notifyDataSetChanged ( ) [virtual]

This method should be called by the application if the data backing this provider has changed and associated widgets should update.

virtual void gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::setPrimaryItem ( gaia::core::WidgetController *  container,
int32_t  position,
gaia::core::Widget *  object 
) [virtual]

Called to inform the provider of which item is currently considered to be the "primary", that is the one show to the user as the current page.

Parameters:
containerThe containing Widget from which the page will be removed.
positionThe page position that is now the primary.
objectThe same object that was returned by instantiateItem(Widget, int).
virtual void gaia::ui::IPagerProvider::startUpdate ( gaia::core::WidgetController *  container) [virtual]

Called when a change in the shown pages is going to start being made.

Parameters:
containerThe containing Widget which is displaying this provider's page widgets.
